item.title: Report X-2024050412
item.description:
Report X-2024050412

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was brought to the attention of AM QA (preload) and was processed by (ID 3367368). My concerns are as follows: the package was soiled/stained due the crushed product that is the Nu-Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner which caused it to leak about 10% of the 3.8 liters within the jug. One of Four were damaged. There was no inner packaging - just the four plastic jugs. It could have had some sort of air bubbles, bubble wrap, or even paper.

item.title: Report E-2024050037
item.description:
Report E-2024050037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 25, 2024, six (6) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for further disposal.
